text:
Thanks for you answers!
What Mark is saying is using HubL on the page level above the React app and then passing data as prop. That's cool but that can be done only once, when the page is loaded. The point of us using React is to have a single page app and avoid all the loading on every click. What I was thinking with my question is about using HubL within React components, so I can manipulate with it on the React component level, and not on HubSpot page level.

I don't know HubSpot's architecture nor whether this would be possible in any way, but since HubSpot is built via React too I thought maybe there is a way. :slightly_smiling_face:
You would use HubSpot’s APIs and where authentication is needed - use serverless functions to get changes to the data after that initial page load.
